contentrichtext.text: :''[[Baten Kaitos: Eternal Wings and the Lost Ocean|Baten Kaitos]] is also the name of a [[role-playing game]] for the [[Nintendo]] [[Nintendo GameCube|Gamecube]]'' '''Zeta Ceti''' (ζ Cet, ζ Ceti) is a [[star]] in the [[constellation]] [[Cetus]]. It has the traditional name '''Baten Kaitos''' ([[Arabic language|Arabic]] ''batn qaytus'' '''بطن قيتوس''' - "belly of the sea monster"). In the catalogue of stars in the ''Calendarium'' of [[Al Achsasi al Mouakket]], this star was designated '''Rabah al Naamat''' ('''رابع ألنعامة''' - ''raabi3 al naʽāmāt''), which was translated into [[Latin]] as '''Quarta Struthionum''', meaning ''the fourth ostrich''.<ref>{{cite journal | last=Knobel | first=E. B. | title=Al Achsasi Al Mouakket, on a catalogue of stars in the Calendarium of Mohammad Al Achsasi Al Mouakket | journal=Monthly Notices of the Royal Astronomical Society | volume=55 | page=429 | month=June | year=1895 | bibcode=1895MNRAS..55..429K }}</ref> This star, along with [[Eta Ceti|η Cet]] (Deneb Algenubi), [[Theta Ceti|θ Cet]] (Thanih Al Naamat), [[Tau Ceti|τ Cet]] (Thalath Al Naamat), and [[Upsilon Ceti|υ Cet]], were '''Al Naʽāmāt''' ('''ألنعامة'''), the Hen Ostriches.<ref>{{cite book | last=Allen | first=R. H. | year=1963 | authorlink=Richard Hinckley Allen | title=Star Names: Their Lore and Meaning | url=http://penelope.uchicago.edu/Thayer/E/Gazetteer/Topics/astronomy/_Texts/secondary/ALLSTA/Cetus*.html | accessdate=2010-12-12 | edition=Reprint | publisher=Dover Publications Inc | location=New York | isbn=0-486-21079-0 | page=162 }}</ref><ref>[[Eta Ceti|η Cet]] as '''Aoul al Naamat''' or '''Prima Struthionum''' (the first ostrich), [[Theta Ceti|θ Cet]] as '''Thanih al Naamat''' or '''Secunda Struthionum''' (the second ostrich), [[Tau Ceti|τ Cet]] as '''Thalath al Naamat''' or '''Tertia Struthionum''' (the third ostrich), and ζ Cet as '''Rabah al Naamat''' or '''Quarta Struthionum''' (the fourth ostrich). [[Upsilon Ceti|υ Cet]] should be '''Khamis al Naamat''' or '''Quinta Struthionum''' (the fifth ostrich) consistently, but Al Achsasi Al Mouakket designated the title ''the fifth ostrich'' to [[Gamma Andromedae|γ Gam]] with uncleared consideration.</ref> In [[Chinese language|Chinese]], {{lang|zh|天倉}} ({{lang|zh-Latn|Tiān Cāng}}), meaning ''[[Bond (Chinese constellation)|Square Celestial Granary]]'', refers to an asterism consisting of ζ Ceti, [[Iota Ceti|ι Ceti]], [[Theta Ceti|θ Ceti]], [[Eta Ceti|η Ceti]], [[Tau Ceti|τ Ceti]] and [[57 Ceti]].<ref>{{zh icon}} ''中國星座神話'', written by 陳久金. Published by 台灣書房出版有限公司, 2005, ISBN 978-986-7332-25-7.</ref> Consequently, ζ Ceti itself is known as {{lang|zh|天倉四}} ({{lang|zh-Latn|Tiān Cāng sì}}, {{lang-en|the Second Star of Square Celestial Granary}}.)<ref>{{zh icon}} [http://www.lcsd.gov.hk/CE/Museum/Space/Research/StarName/c_research_chinengstars_ama_b.htm 香港太空館 - 研究資源 - 亮星中英對照表], Hong Kong Space Museum. Accessed on line November 23, 2010.</ref> ==Structure== Zeta Ceti is a yellowish star of [[stellar classification|spectral class]] K0 IIIBa0.1 and is approximately 260 [[light year]]s from the Earth. Its [[apparent magnitude]] is +3.9. *Coordinates for the equinox [[J2000]]: **[[Right ascension]]: {{RA|01|51|28}} **[[Declination]]: {{DEC|−10|20|06}} ==References== {{reflist}} {{Stars of Cetus}} [[Category:Cetus (constellation)]] [[Category:Bayer objects|Ceti, Zeta]] [[Category:Stars with proper names]]
